segments.text: Looking at this kitchen, I notice the woman totally absorbed in drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's wearing an apron, looking every bit the busy homemaker.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the sink behind her is a disaster, water pouring out over the edge.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not hear or see that mess?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is spreading across the floor, soaking her shoe already.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Over on the other side, kids are up to no good with the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balanced precariously on that stool, stretching high.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: If it tips, he'll come crashing down with cookies flying everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just egging him on, hand outstretched like she's entitled to some.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole setup screams negligence; someone needs to step in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The open cabinets make it easy for them, but so dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside the window, everything looks perfect, which makes the inside chaos even worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for what might happen next.
segments.speaker: PAR
